sequence.notes: Conversion of an aromatic primary amine to an aromatic diazonium salt using sodium nitrite and acid at low temperature.

Formation of Olsalazine (Dipentum) via azo coupling of a diazonium salt of 2-hydroxy-5-aminobenzoic acid with salicylic acid. The screenshot indicates the reactant is a diazonium salt of a substituted benzoic acid and the reagent is salicylic acid. The reaction is an electrophilic aromatic substitution where the diazonium acts as an electrophile.
